posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey campgod!

So, what you need to understand is the "characteristics" of each type of build. Notoriously, STR-based Rangers are damage-dealing machines with very little defense. This happens because of the damage bonuses versus Favored Enemies and Bane of Enemies, high AB and generally High Strength. However, Rangers don't get any defensive class features, except a boost for Hiding skills via Camouflage / Mass Camouflage. In that sense, that custom HiPS bonus can be an interesting tool for that defensive purpose, so long as they're buffed with Camouflage and Mass Camouflage and probably in Light Armor (Heavy Armor incurs a skill check penalty for Stealth skills, but it's still doable, provided you have the proficiency). Generally, over 25 levels of Ranger are recommended on damage-dealing Rangers because of the access to multiple types of FEs (to cover all the base classes of the game). They rely on killing the enemy before it kills them and HiPS can be a good getaway clause if things get nasty, but you should by all means outdamage most if not all meleers. The damage output of the Grim Ripper, for instance, is gigantic. He will tear through opposition like there's no tomorrow. Most STR-based Rangers should be that way.

Here is an example of a build I will send you one I have in my grimoire, which needs tweaks to fit your server, you can go Ranger 26 Fighter 4 Assassin 10 (so you get Improved INV) or Ranger 29 Fighter 6 Assassin 5 just to fulfill the requirements, but I don't have time to tweak it for you, so you gotta do it yourself:

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Ok, before my next student comes in, let me try to talk a bit more about DEX rangers.

Basically, DEX rangers can be Archers or Meleers. This type of build synergizes more with the overall skillset, IMO. Why? Because:

- Rangers get the dual-wielding feats for free ONLY WHEN WEARING LIGHT ARMOR. The only way to wear a light armor and not have abysmal AC is to go DEX.

- Rangers get the Cat's Grace spell, and Camouflage and Mass Camouflage boosts in this type of build are more significant, as your base scores will be much higher than in a STR build in terms of Stealth skills.

- Rangers get Set Trap as a class skill. Sure a STR-based Ranger can set up to deadly traps, but why would he waste his time setting traps if he can obliterate you with a couple of blows? Traps are a good alternative source of damage for toons who need ways of doing damage, not for 2-handed juggernauts.

- Rangers get Hide and Move Silently as class skills and many skill points per level, which generally synergizes well with Sneak Attack or Death Attack and HiPS. The fact that Rangers get these skills allow them to fit requirements for Assassin and Shadowdancer (not the Tumble one).

- Rangers have Favored Enemies and Bane of Enemies to provide a nice source of damage against their FEs. This bit works well with STR and DEX toons alike. For STR it increases an already sick damage output, for DEX it gives a good alternate source of damage.

In both situations (Melee and Archer), DEX-based Rangers have to find a way to DO DAMAGE, but they have many tools at their disposal to achieve that goal. First, melee ones: going Ranger Rogue Shadowdancer is VERY COMMON because of the Hiding and Dex buffs from Camouflage, Mass Camouflage (which stack with each other) and Cat's Grace. Rogue comes in as an alternate source of damage through Sneak Attacks and supplies the skill points to invest in trap skills, both good alternate sources of damage, and SD ices the cake with HiPS. Bane of Enemies takes care of the damage versus FEs, but not against anything else. Strategically choosing the FEs in this type of build is mandatory. If you are playing PvM, try to choose FEs that are immune to criticals and sneaks and/or have DR, and for PvP, choose player base races.

Archers normally go the Arcane Archer route, which grants sick damage output.

Please note that I'm mostly referring to Ranger as a main class builds. There are also those who get just a couple of levels for free dual-wielding feats.

Take it EZ!

1. Assassin uses poison.

5. Poison cannot be reapplied for 5 minutes or until the Assassin rests, whichever duration is shorter. Poison cannot be applied while Assassin is in combat or while a living hostile creature is nearby. posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content: Scythe is by default is part of the piercing/slashing family. Other piercing/slashing weapons include the halberd and the creature claw item. Both the halberd and the scythe can be affected by keen edge, and any enhancement bonus (for the sake of stacking) acts as an attack bonus plus a slashing damage bonus.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Honestly, that is a terrible build, mate. No offense, but too many imprecisions that it's not even worth saving. The spread is awful, you can't take Curse song without having Bard song and if you aren't going for Devcrit, then why would you keep Power Attack, Cleave and Great Cleave? Furthermore, if you want Bane of Enemies, it is good when you actually have many enemies to apply the bonus damage to, so why would you drop Ranger levels that would give you extra feats for Bard levels that will give you VERY LITTLE (a handful of skill points and a few dispellable and low duration spells) in return?

I would stick with Tyr Templar's build as she is the meleer elder of the guild, and if you want to make it accessible in your server, go Ranger 25 Bard 5 RDD 10 and choose one feat to drop. You will have access to Improved Invisibility and haste via scrolls or wands, just not of spells. Worst case scenario, carry around some potions of Haste.

Now, I will be very honest with you, maybe even blunt, although my intention is the best possible (to try to get you to understand more about NWN character building). Judging by your questions and the build you have just posted, I have to say that you just are not equipped to understand the advice that is being given to you. I have been in that position in the past, and it's not a fun spot to be in. In truth, you have a long way ahead of you to get to a point where you have enough information to actually understand what we are talking about when we propose some things to you. You can start by reading my guide about character building. Once the info there sinks in, you may start delving deeper into the classes. Here is a link:

Guide to the basics of building

I hope I have not offended you. Again, that was not my intention. I wish you all the best in beginning your learning process.
